sentences.en: An employee is not eligible for a redundancy payment unless he has been with the company for two years.
sentences.cn: 在公司工作满两年的雇员才有资格拿遣散费。

sentences.en: But avoid redundancy: Define an item in the glossary or in the domain model, but not in both.
sentences.cn: 但要避免冗余：在术语表或域模型中定义一个条目，但是不要在两者里面都下定义。

sentences.en: I stuck out for a handsome redundancy package.
sentences.cn: 我坚持要求得到一大笔裁员补偿。

sentences.en: In addition, each piece can be clustered so that you have redundancy at the layer level.
sentences.cn: 另外，每个部分都可以使用集群，这样就可以在层次级别上具有一些冗余。

sentences.en: John had taken out redundancy insurance but when he tried to claim, he was refused payment.
sentences.cn: 约翰办理过失业保险，可是当他去索赔时却遭拒付。

sentences.en: Many workers can only eke out their redundancy money for about 10 weeks.
sentences.cn: 很多工人手头的遣散费仅够维持10个星期左右。

sentences.en: Redundancy can be a demoralising prospect.
sentences.cn: 面临裁员可能会令士气低落。

sentences.en: Redundancy is the spur for many to embark on new careers.
sentences.cn: 裁员促使很多人开始从事新事业。

sentences.en: Redundancy notices have been sent to 200 workers.
sentences.cn: 200名工人接到了裁员通知.

sentences.en: Redundancy payments are tax-free up to £50,000.
sentences.cn: 低于5万英镑的遣散费免于纳税。

sentences.en: The closure of the export department resulted in over 100 redundancies.
sentences.cn: 出口部关闭导致一百多人被解雇。

sentences.en: The company has had to make redundancy payments of £472 million.
sentences.cn: 该公司不得不为裁员支付4.72亿英镑的补偿款。

sentences.en: The really heavy redundancy costs have been accounted for.
sentences.cn: 非常庞大的裁员开支已被列入预算。

sentences.en: The term "early retirement" is nearly always a euphemism for redundancy nowadays.
sentences.cn: 现在“提前退休”几乎就是裁员的委婉说法。

sentences.en: The threat of redundancy was suddenly removed.
sentences.cn: 裁员的威胁顿时消除了.

sentences.en: Think carefully before you insure against accident, sickness and redundancy.
sentences.cn: 在为意外事故、疾病与失业投保之前一定要考虑清楚。

sentences.en: This means that they have no redundancy.
sentences.cn: 这意味着，它们没有冗余。

sentences.en: Thousands of bank employees are facing redundancy as their employers cut costs.
sentences.cn: 雇主削减成本的时候，数千名银行雇员面临被解雇的命运。

sentences.en: Thousands of factory workers are facing redundancy.
sentences.cn: 数千名工厂工人面临裁汰。

sentences.en: Two thousand workers now face redundancy.
sentences.cn: 2,000 名工人现在面临失业。

sentences.en: You can hedge against redundancy or illness with insurance.
sentences.cn: 可以购买保险以防失业或患病。

words.tran_cn: [计][数]冗余（等于redundance）；裁员；人浮于事

phrases.tran_cn: 冗余核对；过剩信息校验

trans.tran_cn: 过多，过剩，冗长，裁员，（机器的）多余度
trans.tran_en: a situation in which someone has to leave their job, because they are no longer needed
